issue.title: Run VMs as 'restricted' PSA pods

labels.name: release-note

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR makes all the required changes to default to run VMs inside Pods compliant with the 'restricted' PSA level. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8563.
e2e tests and unit tests are still to be addressed.

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->
```release-note
KubeVirt is now able to run VMs inside restricted namespaces.
The PSA feature gate is deprecated.

Breaking changes if you run KubeVirt in a cluster with PSA enabled while using 'restricted' as the default level:
- PostCopy needs a privileged namespace, otherwise it will get disabled (if set at the cluster level) or rejected (if set through a migration policy)
- VMs using Passt and VirtioFS need a privilege namespace to run
- When migrating an existing VM with PostCopy as part of an upgrade you need to label the namespace as privileged (after the upgrade the permission level of the namespace can be reset) before starting the upgrade procedure otherwise if the migration is able to converge only with PostCopy it will fail.
```

issue.title: sig-network: Proposal - Run only latest k8s version as presubmit, rest as periodics
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe**:
Currently each PR runs 5 lanes of sig-network (not only sig-network but focusing on it on this proposal)
`k8s-1.22-sig-network`
`k8s-1.23-sig-network`
`k8s-1.24-sig-network`
`k8s-1.23-sig-network non root`
`k8s-1.24-sig-network single stack ipv6`

All those lanes make CI very busy, and we us all waiting a lot of time
to see results / to merge PRs.

It is very rare that old k8s versions have regression that is flaky,
at the worst case if a feature breaks, it breaks totally
and on the latest versions, not on the previous.

**Describe the solution you'd like**:
We suggest to make at least those periodic (maybe even more of the above list)
`k8s-1.22-sig-network`
`k8s-1.23-sig-network`

The periodic test-grid will send email to the sig-network group
and we will monitor those.
EDIT - or send to a dedicated slack channel as we are doing with the other periodics.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**:
See please
https://groups.google.com/g/kubevirt-dev/c/c0U4lv6PYcM/m/9ZZ9-aQZBAAJ?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer&pli=1
Please comment whatever the alternatives you suggest or any comments.

Investigate usage of Tekton with prow
https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/issues/13874#issuecomment-521237150

**Additional context**:

comment.body:

Mark the issue as fresh with `/remove-lifecycle stale`.
Stale issues rot after an additional 30d of inactivity and eventually close.

If this issue is safe to close now please do so with `/close`.

/lifecycle stale

issue.body:
<!-- Make sure that you visit our User Guide at https://kubevirt.io/user-guide.
-->

**What happened**:
On my cluster with kubevirt creating vms and pods.When the kubelet service down on one node,the pod and vm can not be rescheduling to other nodes.
The pod is in terminating status.The VM is False.

```
kubectl get pods
NAME                        READY   STATUS        RESTARTS   AGE
virt-launcher-migra-6bc86   1/1     Terminating   0          21m

```
```
kubectl get vm
NAME    AGE    STATUS    READY
migra   128m   Running   False
```
Even I delete the terminating  pod use --force the pod also can not reschedule:
``` 
kubectl delete pods virt-launcher-migra-6bc86 --force
```


**What you expected to happen**:
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

The pod and vm can reschedule on health nodes when the kubelet service down.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Steps to reproduce the behavior.
Stop the kubelet service on one node in a cluster.

issue.title: Run VMs as 'restricted' PSA pods

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by an approver from all required OWNERS files.

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR makes all the required changes to default to run VMs inside Pods compliant with the 'restricted' PSA level. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8563.
e2e tests and unit tests are still to be addressed.

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->
```release-note
KubeVirt is now able to run VMs inside restricted namespaces.
The PSA feature gate is deprecated.

Breaking changes if you run KubeVirt in a cluster with PSA enabled while using 'restricted' as the default level:
- PostCopy needs a privileged namespace, otherwise it will get disabled (if set at the cluster level) or rejected (if set through a migration policy)
- VMs using Passt and VirtioFS need a privilege namespace to run
- When migrating an existing VM with PostCopy as part of an upgrade you need to label the namespace as privileged (after the upgrade the permission level of the namespace can be reset) before starting the upgrade procedure otherwise if the migration is able to converge only with PostCopy it will fail.
```

issue.title: Run VMs as 'restricted' PSA pods

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by an approver from all required OWNERS files.

labels.name: kind/build-change
labels.description: Categorizes PRs as related to changing build files of virt-* components

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR makes all the required changes to default to run VMs inside Pods compliant with the 'restricted' PSA level. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8563.
e2e tests and unit tests are still to be addressed.

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->
```release-note
KubeVirt is now able to run VMs inside restricted namespaces.
The PSA feature gate is deprecated.

Breaking changes if you run KubeVirt in a cluster with PSA enabled while using 'restricted' as the default level:
- PostCopy needs a privileged namespace, otherwise it will get disabled (if set at the cluster level) or rejected (if set through a migration policy)
- VMs using Passt and VirtioFS need a privilege namespace to run
- When migrating an existing VM with PostCopy as part of an upgrade you need to label the namespace as privileged (after the upgrade the permission level of the namespace can be reset) before starting the upgrade procedure otherwise if the migration is able to converge only with PostCopy it will fail.
```

issue.title: Run VMs as 'restricted' PSA pods

labels.name: release-note

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR makes all the required changes to default to run VMs inside Pods compliant with the 'restricted' PSA level. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8563.
e2e tests and unit tests are still to be addressed.

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->
```release-note
KubeVirt is now able to run VMs inside restricted namespaces.
The PSA feature gate is deprecated.

Breaking changes if you run KubeVirt in a cluster with PSA enabled while using 'restricted' as the default level:
- PostCopy needs a privileged namespace, otherwise it will get disabled (if set at the cluster level) or rejected (if set through a migration policy)
- VMs using Passt and VirtioFS need a privilege namespace to run
- When migrating an existing VM with PostCopy as part of an upgrade you need to label the namespace as privileged (after the upgrade the permission level of the namespace can be reset) before starting the upgrade procedure otherwise if the migration is able to converge only with PostCopy it will fail.
```

issue.title: Add ability to watch Kubevirt objects
issue.body:
Currently, Kubevirt client set does not support watch calls, e.g.:
```go
virtClient.Kubevirt(namespace).Watch(...)
```

Also, while some of our clients are auto-generated (e.g. [clone client](https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/blob/v0.55.0/staging/src/kubevirt.io/client-go/generated/kubevirt/clientset/versioned/typed/clone/v1alpha1/virtualmachineclone.go)), the [Kubevirt client](https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/blob/v0.55.0/staging/src/kubevirt.io/client-go/kubecli/kv.go) is not.

Unless there's a good reason for it, I guess it should be auto-generated.
If not, at least it should support the ability to watch the object.

**Advantages:**
The ability to watch Kubevirt will help us gain better ability to test Kubevirt. In [this PR](https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8184), for example, I needed to consistently `.Get(...)` Kubevirt instead of watching it. In this specific case it the change can happen very quickly, so the polling is done frequently, which is wasteful.

This can speed up our tests suit in general. Many tests today are continuously fetching the Kubevirt resource to perform checks.

issue.title: Run VMs as 'restricted' PSA pods

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR makes all the required changes to default to run VMs inside Pods compliant with the 'restricted' PSA level. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8563.
e2e tests and unit tests are still to be addressed.

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->
```release-note
KubeVirt is now able to run VMs inside restricted namespaces.
The PSA feature gate is deprecated.

Breaking changes if you run KubeVirt in a cluster with PSA enabled while using 'restricted' as the default level:
- PostCopy needs a privileged namespace, otherwise it will get disabled (if set at the cluster level) or rejected (if set through a migration policy)
- VMs using Passt and VirtioFS need a privilege namespace to run
- When migrating an existing VM with PostCopy as part of an upgrade you need to label the namespace as privileged (after the upgrade the permission level of the namespace can be reset) before starting the upgrade procedure otherwise if the migration is able to converge only with PostCopy it will fail.
```

issue.title: sig-network: Proposal - Run only latest k8s version as presubmit, rest as periodics
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe**:
Currently each PR runs 5 lanes of sig-network (not only sig-network but focusing on it on this proposal)
`k8s-1.22-sig-network`
`k8s-1.23-sig-network`
`k8s-1.24-sig-network`
`k8s-1.23-sig-network non root`
`k8s-1.24-sig-network single stack ipv6`

All those lanes make CI very busy, and we us all waiting a lot of time
to see results / to merge PRs.

It is very rare that old k8s versions have regression that is flaky,
at the worst case if a feature breaks, it breaks totally
and on the latest versions, not on the previous.

**Describe the solution you'd like**:
We suggest to make at least those periodic (maybe even more of the above list)
`k8s-1.22-sig-network`
`k8s-1.23-sig-network`

The periodic test-grid will send email to the sig-network group
and we will monitor those.
EDIT - or send to a dedicated slack channel as we are doing with the other periodics.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**:
See please
https://groups.google.com/g/kubevirt-dev/c/c0U4lv6PYcM/m/9ZZ9-aQZBAAJ?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer&pli=1
Please comment whatever the alternatives you suggest or any comments.

Investigate usage of Tekton with prow
https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/issues/13874#issuecomment-521237150

**Additional context**:

comment.body:
Issues go stale after 90d of inactivity.
Mark the issue as fresh with `/remove-lifecycle stale`.
Stale issues rot after an additional 30d of inactivity and eventually close.

If this issue is safe to close now please do so with `/close`.

/lifecycle stale

issue.title: VM/Pod can not be rescheduling when kubelet service down

labels.name: lifecycle/rotten
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

issue.body:
<!-- Make sure that you visit our User Guide at https://kubevirt.io/user-guide.
-->

**What happened**:
On my cluster with kubevirt creating vms and pods.When the kubelet service down on one node,the pod and vm can not be rescheduling to other nodes.
The pod is in terminating status.The VM is False.

```
kubectl get pods
NAME                        READY   STATUS        RESTARTS   AGE
virt-launcher-migra-6bc86   1/1     Terminating   0          21m

```
```
kubectl get vm
NAME    AGE    STATUS    READY
migra   128m   Running   False
```
Even I delete the terminating  pod use --force the pod also can not reschedule:
``` 
kubectl delete pods virt-launcher-migra-6bc86 --force
```


**What you expected to happen**:
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

The pod and vm can reschedule on health nodes when the kubelet service down.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Steps to reproduce the behavior.
Stop the kubelet service on one node in a cluster.

**Additional context**:
Add any other context about the problem here.

**Environment**:
- KubeVirt version (use `virtctl version`): N/A
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): N/A
- VM or VMI specifications: N/A
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: N/A
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): N/A
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): N/A
- Install tools: N/A
- Others: N/A

>

issue.title: Run VMs as 'restricted' PSA pods

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by an approver from all required OWNERS files.

labels.name: kind/build-change
labels.description: Categorizes PRs as related to changing build files of virt-* components

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR makes all the required changes to default to run VMs inside Pods compliant with the 'restricted' PSA level. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8563.
e2e tests and unit tests are still to be addressed.

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->
```release-note
KubeVirt is now able to run VMs inside restricted namespaces.
The PSA feature gate is deprecated.

Breaking changes if you run KubeVirt in a cluster with PSA enabled while using 'restricted' as the default level:
- PostCopy needs a privileged namespace, otherwise it will get disabled (if set at the cluster level) or rejected (if set through a migration policy)
- VMs using Passt and VirtioFS need a privilege namespace to run
- When migrating an existing VM with PostCopy as part of an upgrade you need to label the namespace as privileged (after the upgrade the permission level of the namespace can be reset) before starting the upgrade procedure otherwise if the migration is able to converge only with PostCopy it will fail.
```

issue.title: Run VMs as 'restricted' PSA pods

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by an approver from all required OWNERS files.

labels.name: kind/build-change
labels.description: Categorizes PRs as related to changing build files of virt-* components

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR makes all the required changes to default to run VMs inside Pods compliant with the 'restricted' PSA level. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8563.
e2e tests and unit tests are still to be addressed.

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->
```release-note
KubeVirt is now able to run VMs inside restricted namespaces.
The PSA feature gate is deprecated.

Breaking changes if you run KubeVirt in a cluster with PSA enabled while using 'restricted' as the default level:
- PostCopy needs a privileged namespace, otherwise it will get disabled (if set at the cluster level) or rejected (if set through a migration policy)
- VMs using Passt and VirtioFS need a privilege namespace to run
- When migrating an existing VM with PostCopy as part of an upgrade you need to label the namespace as privileged (after the upgrade the permission level of the namespace can be reset) before starting the upgrade procedure otherwise if the migration is able to converge only with PostCopy it will fail.
```

issue.title: Run VMs as 'restricted' PSA pods

labels.name: release-note

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR makes all the required changes to default to run VMs inside Pods compliant with the 'restricted' PSA level. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8563.
e2e tests and unit tests are still to be addressed.

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->
```release-note
KubeVirt is now able to run VMs inside restricted namespaces.
The PSA feature gate is deprecated.

Breaking changes if you run KubeVirt in a cluster with PSA enabled while using 'restricted' as the default level:
- PostCopy needs a privileged namespace, otherwise it will get disabled (if set at the cluster level) or rejected (if set through a migration policy)
- VMs using Passt and VirtioFS need a privilege namespace to run
- When migrating an existing VM with PostCopy as part of an upgrade you need to label the namespace as privileged (after the upgrade the permission level of the namespace can be reset) before starting the upgrade procedure otherwise if the migration is able to converge only with PostCopy it will fail.
```

issue.title: Add ability to watch Kubevirt objects
issue.body:
Currently, Kubevirt client set does not support watch calls, e.g.:
```go
virtClient.Kubevirt(namespace).Watch(...)
```

Also, while some of our clients are auto-generated (e.g. [clone client](https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/blob/v0.55.0/staging/src/kubevirt.io/client-go/generated/kubevirt/clientset/versioned/typed/clone/v1alpha1/virtualmachineclone.go)), the [Kubevirt client](https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/blob/v0.55.0/staging/src/kubevirt.io/client-go/kubecli/kv.go) is not.

Unless there's a good reason for it, I guess it should be auto-generated.
If not, at least it should support the ability to watch the object.

**Advantages:**
The ability to watch Kubevirt will help us gain better ability to test Kubevirt. In [this PR](https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8184), for example, I needed to consistently `.Get(...)` Kubevirt instead of watching it. In this specific case it the change can happen very quickly, so the polling is done frequently, which is wasteful.

This can speed up our tests suit in general. Many tests today are continuously fetching the Kubevirt resource to perform checks.

issue.title: Run VMs as 'restricted' PSA pods

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR makes all the required changes to default to run VMs inside Pods compliant with the 'restricted' PSA level. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8563.
e2e tests and unit tests are still to be addressed.

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->
```release-note
KubeVirt is now able to run VMs inside restricted namespaces.
The PSA feature gate is deprecated.

Breaking changes if you run KubeVirt in a cluster with PSA enabled while using 'restricted' as the default level:
- PostCopy needs a privileged namespace, otherwise it will get disabled (if set at the cluster level) or rejected (if set through a migration policy)
- VMs using Passt and VirtioFS need a privilege namespace to run
- When migrating an existing VM with PostCopy as part of an upgrade you need to label the namespace as privileged (after the upgrade the permission level of the namespace can be reset) before starting the upgrade procedure otherwise if the migration is able to converge only with PostCopy it will fail.
```

issue.title: sig-network: Proposal - Run only latest k8s version as presubmit, rest as periodics
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe**:
Currently each PR runs 5 lanes of sig-network (not only sig-network but focusing on it on this proposal)
`k8s-1.22-sig-network`
`k8s-1.23-sig-network`
`k8s-1.24-sig-network`
`k8s-1.23-sig-network non root`
`k8s-1.24-sig-network single stack ipv6`

All those lanes make CI very busy, and we us all waiting a lot of time
to see results / to merge PRs.

It is very rare that old k8s versions have regression that is flaky,
at the worst case if a feature breaks, it breaks totally
and on the latest versions, not on the previous.

**Describe the solution you'd like**:
We suggest to make at least those periodic (maybe even more of the above list)
`k8s-1.22-sig-network`
`k8s-1.23-sig-network`

The periodic test-grid will send email to the sig-network group
and we will monitor those.
EDIT - or send to a dedicated slack channel as we are doing with the other periodics.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**:
See please
https://groups.google.com/g/kubevirt-dev/c/c0U4lv6PYcM/m/9ZZ9-aQZBAAJ?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer&pli=1
Please comment whatever the alternatives you suggest or any comments.

Investigate usage of Tekton with prow
https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/issues/13874#issuecomment-521237150

**Additional context**:

comment.body:
Issues go stale after 90d of inactivity.
Mark the issue as fresh with `/remove-lifecycle stale`.
Stale issues rot after an additional 30d of inactivity and eventually close.

If this issue is safe to close now please do so with `/close`.

/lifecycle stale

issue.title: VM/Pod can not be rescheduling when kubelet service down

labels.name: lifecycle/rotten
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

issue.body:
<!-- Make sure that you visit our User Guide at https://kubevirt.io/user-guide.
-->

**What happened**:
On my cluster with kubevirt creating vms and pods.When the kubelet service down on one node,the pod and vm can not be rescheduling to other nodes.
The pod is in terminating status.The VM is False.

```
kubectl get pods
NAME                        READY   STATUS        RESTARTS   AGE
virt-launcher-migra-6bc86   1/1     Terminating   0          21m

```
```
kubectl get vm
NAME    AGE    STATUS    READY
migra   128m   Running   False
```
Even I delete the terminating  pod use --force the pod also can not reschedule:
``` 
kubectl delete pods virt-launcher-migra-6bc86 --force
```


**What you expected to happen**:
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

The pod and vm can reschedule on health nodes when the kubelet service down.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Steps to reproduce the behavior.
Stop the kubelet service on one node in a cluster.

**Additional context**:
Add any other context about the problem here.

**Environment**:
- KubeVirt version (use `virtctl version`): N/A
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): N/A
- VM or VMI specifications: N/A
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: N/A
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): N/A
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): N/A
- Install tools: N/A
- Others: N/A

>

issue.title: Run VMs as 'restricted' PSA pods

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by an approver from all required OWNERS files.

labels.name: kind/build-change
labels.description: Categorizes PRs as related to changing build files of virt-* components

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR makes all the required changes to default to run VMs inside Pods compliant with the 'restricted' PSA level. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8563.
e2e tests and unit tests are still to be addressed.

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->
```release-note
KubeVirt is now able to run VMs inside restricted namespaces.
The PSA feature gate is deprecated.

Breaking changes if you run KubeVirt in a cluster with PSA enabled while using 'restricted' as the default level:
- PostCopy needs a privileged namespace, otherwise it will get disabled (if set at the cluster level) or rejected (if set through a migration policy)
- VMs using Passt and VirtioFS need a privilege namespace to run
- When migrating an existing VM with PostCopy as part of an upgrade you need to label the namespace as privileged (after the upgrade the permission level of the namespace can be reset) before starting the upgrade procedure otherwise if the migration is able to converge only with PostCopy it will fail.
```

issue.title: Run VMs as 'restricted' PSA pods

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by an approver from all required OWNERS files.

labels.name: kind/build-change
labels.description: Categorizes PRs as related to changing build files of virt-* components

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR makes all the required changes to default to run VMs inside Pods compliant with the 'restricted' PSA level. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8563.
e2e tests and unit tests are still to be addressed.

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->
```release-note
KubeVirt is now able to run VMs inside restricted namespaces.
The PSA feature gate is deprecated.

Breaking changes if you run KubeVirt in a cluster with PSA enabled while using 'restricted' as the default level:
- PostCopy needs a privileged namespace, otherwise it will get disabled (if set at the cluster level) or rejected (if set through a migration policy)
- VMs using Passt and VirtioFS need a privilege namespace to run
- When migrating an existing VM with PostCopy as part of an upgrade you need to label the namespace as privileged (after the upgrade the permission level of the namespace can be reset) before starting the upgrade procedure otherwise if the migration is able to converge only with PostCopy it will fail.
```

issue.title: Run VMs as 'restricted' PSA pods

labels.name: release-note

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR makes all the required changes to default to run VMs inside Pods compliant with the 'restricted' PSA level. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8563.
e2e tests and unit tests are still to be addressed.

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->
```release-note
KubeVirt is now able to run VMs inside restricted namespaces.
The PSA feature gate is deprecated.

Breaking changes if you run KubeVirt in a cluster with PSA enabled while using 'restricted' as the default level:
- PostCopy needs a privileged namespace, otherwise it will get disabled (if set at the cluster level) or rejected (if set through a migration policy)
- VMs using Passt and VirtioFS need a privilege namespace to run
- When migrating an existing VM with PostCopy as part of an upgrade you need to label the namespace as privileged (after the upgrade the permission level of the namespace can be reset) before starting the upgrade procedure otherwise if the migration is able to converge only with PostCopy it will fail.
```

issue.title: Add ability to watch Kubevirt objects
issue.body:
Currently, Kubevirt client set does not support watch calls, e.g.:
```go
virtClient.Kubevirt(namespace).Watch(...)
```

Also, while some of our clients are auto-generated (e.g. [clone client](https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/blob/v0.55.0/staging/src/kubevirt.io/client-go/generated/kubevirt/clientset/versioned/typed/clone/v1alpha1/virtualmachineclone.go)), the [Kubevirt client](https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/blob/v0.55.0/staging/src/kubevirt.io/client-go/kubecli/kv.go) is not.

Unless there's a good reason for it, I guess it should be auto-generated.
If not, at least it should support the ability to watch the object.

**Advantages:**
The ability to watch Kubevirt will help us gain better ability to test Kubevirt. In [this PR](https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8184), for example, I needed to consistently `.Get(...)` Kubevirt instead of watching it. In this specific case it the change can happen very quickly, so the polling is done frequently, which is wasteful.

This can speed up our tests suit in general. Many tests today are continuously fetching the Kubevirt resource to perform checks.
